meanings.definition: Greet with pleasure or kindly courtesy.
meanings.sent1: I always welcome my friends with a big smile.
meanings.sent2: The hostess will welcome the guests at the party.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to welcome the mouse into its home.
meanings.sent4: The sun's rays warmly welcome the flowers each morning.
meanings.sent5: The cozy fire in the fireplace welcomed us after a long day.

meanings.sent1: The new student received a welcome greeting from her classmates.
meanings.sent2: The warm weather was a welcome change from the cold winter.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected gift was a welcome surprise for the family.
meanings.sent4: The rain brought a welcome relief to the dry, thirsty plants.
meanings.sent5: The cozy blanket was a welcome comfort on the chilly night.

meanings.definition: A kindly greeting or reception, as to one whose arrival gives pleasure.
meanings.sent1: The warm welcome from the host made the guests feel at home.
meanings.sent2: The cheers and applause were a welcome to the winning team.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy gave a playful welcome to the new kitten.
meanings.sent4: The colorful decorations provided a festive welcome to the party.
meanings.sent5: The sweet aroma of baking bread was a delicious welcome to the bakery.
